definition: lacking the warmth of life, the absence of heat
details:
adjective
- lacking the warmth of life
= example: lacking the warmth of life
- of a seeker
= synonyms: warm
- unconscious from a blow or shock or intoxication
= example: unconscious from a blow or shock or intoxication
- feeling or showing no enthusiasm
= example: feeling or showing no enthusiasm
- having lost freshness through passage of time
= example: having lost freshness through passage of time
- having a low or inadequate temperature or feeling a sensation of coldness or having been made cold by e.g. ice or refrigeration
= example: having a low or inadequate temperature or feeling a sensation of coldness or having been made cold by e.g. ice or refrigeration
- extended meanings
= example: extended meanings
= synonyms: hot
- without compunction or human feeling
= example: without compunction or human feeling
= synonyms: insensate, inhuman, cold-blooded
- sexually unresponsive
= example: sexually unresponsive
= synonyms: frigid
- so intense as to be almost uncontrollable
= example: so intense as to be almost uncontrollable
- lacking originality or spontaneity
= synonyms: stale, dusty, moth-eaten
- marked by errorless familiarity
= example: marked by errorless familiarity
- (color) giving no sensation of warmth
= example: (color) giving no sensation of warmth
noun
- the absence of heat
= example: the absence of heat
= synonyms: coldness, frigidity, frigidness, low temperature
- the sensation produced by low temperatures
= example: the sensation produced by low temperatures
= synonyms: coldness
- a mild viral infection involving the nose and respiratory passages (but not the lungs)
= example: a mild viral infection involving the nose and respiratory passages (but not the lungs)
= synonyms: common cold
